meanings.definition: Light and soft to the touch
meanings.sent1: The kitten's fur was so fluffy that it felt like a cloud.
meanings.sent2: I love hugging my fluffy pillow before going to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy blanket wrapped around me like a warm hug.
meanings.sent4: Her fluffy sweater made her look like a walking marshmallow.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy cotton candy melted in my mouth, leaving a sweet sensation.

meanings.definition: Covered in soft, thick hair or fur
meanings.sent1: The fluffy bunny had long ears and a white coat.
meanings.sent2: She adored her fluffy dog that always greeted her with wagging tail.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy teddy bear seemed to come to life in her arms.
meanings.sent4: The fluffy clouds in the sky resembled a giant cotton ball.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy caterpillar slowly crawled along the branch, its fur shimmering in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Having a light and airy texture
meanings.sent1: The cake was so fluffy that it practically floated off the plate.
meanings.sent2: Her fluffy pancakes were a hit at the breakfast table.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy whipped cream on top of the hot cocoa looked like a mini cloud.
meanings.sent4: The fluffy marshmallows in the hot chocolate melted with each sip.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy popcorn popped in the microwave, filling the room with a buttery aroma.

meanings.sent1: The fluffy excuse he gave for being late was easily seen through.
meanings.sent2: Her fluffy promises never seemed to materialize into reality.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy conversation left everyone feeling unsatisfied and confused.
meanings.sent4: His fluffy arguments fell apart under closer examination.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy compliments she received felt insincere and empty.
